title: Start your blog with just a static site and Github
shortDescription: An electron-based application that simplifies blog management by integrating with GitHub to store, update and manage blog posts as JSON files.
content:
I've been working on this little Electron app that lets me manage blog posts. With a little twist of syncing up with GitHub, so every post I create, update, or delete is safely stored as a JSON file in my repo.


Blogging Made Easy: Whether I'm creating up a new post or making changes to an old one, it’s a lot simple. Having the blogs in GitHub repo, there's version control too and easy access.

No Server Costs: You don’t have to worry about server hosting or deploying a backend. Everything's handled by GitHub and the app, so it’s totally free to run.

No Need for Jekyll or Other Frameworks: If you're looking for something dynamic to host blogs without using things like Jekyll and all then this solution works best


This setup makes everything so much easier for me since I'm hosting my site on Render. It’s practically just a static site, with the only dynamic part being the fetching of the blogs.json file in my repository root. just a clean and simple way to manage content.


Can also be noted that you can use GitHub Pages with this which would all come down to practically all GitHub and no cost for a site that adds dynamic content.
